intro: Sedum perezdelarosae, commonly known as the Perú sedum, is a succulent plant native to the Andes mountains of Peru. It is characterized by its fleshy, blue-green leaves that are arranged in a rosette pattern. The plant produces small, star-shaped yellow flowers during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
